page.title: 02CALLINGTON SCHOOLS
page.content: The{county primary school }occupies the old grammar school building with extensions. It has 371 pupils,14 teachers and an average class size of 30. No external examinations are taken. There are nine governors. Subjects taught include science, environment and health. The grammar and secondary modern schools formed the{comprehensive school}in 1971. There are 1210 pupils, many brought by bus from a wide area. There are 70 teachers and a board of 16 governors. Pupils sit for{Cambridge Board O and A {levels, SW Board CSE and RSA {Commercial and City and Guilds. Extra-Curricula and sporting activities are organised in house groups. {The County Agricultural {Centre}at the school gives special training to school leavers.
